00001 #########################################################################
00002 #
00003 #  Implements the Matrix class.
00004 #
00005 package Parser::List::Matrix;
00006 use strict;
00007 our @ISA = qw(Parser::List);
00008 
00009 #
00010 #  The main checks are all done in the List object.
00011 #  Here, we just convert the entry types from points or
00012 #    vectors to matrices (hack) with appropriate parens.
00013 #
00014 sub _check {
00015   my $self = shift;
00016   my $matrix = $self->{equation}{context}{lists}{Matrix};
00017   $self->{open} = $matrix->{open}; $self->{close} = $matrix->{close};
00018   if ($self->{entryType}{name} ne 'Matrix') {
00019     foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}})
00020       {$x->makeMatrix($self->{type}{name},$self->{open},$self->{close})}
00021   }
00022   return if $self->context->flag("allowBadOperands");
00023   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {
00024     $self->{equation}->Error("Entries in a Matrix must be Numbers or Lists of Numbers")
00025       unless ($x->type =~ m/Number|Matrix/);
00026   }
00027 }
00028 
00029 #
00030 #  Handle a 2-dimensional matrix as a special case, using
00031 #  LaTeX's \array command.
00032 #
00033 sub TeX {
00034   my ($self,$precedence) = @_;
00035   return $self->SUPER::TeX(@_) unless $self->entryType->{entryType};
00036   my ($open,$close) = ($self->{open},$self->{close});
00037   $open = '\{' if $open eq '{'; $close = '\}' if $close eq '}';
00038   my $TeX = ''; my @entries = (); my $d;
00039   foreach my $row (@{$self->coords}) {
00040     foreach my $x (@{$row->coords}) {push(@entries,$x->TeX)}
00041     $TeX .= join(' &',@entries) . '\cr'."\n";
00042     $d = scalar(@entries); @entries = ();
00043   }
00044   $TeX = '\begin{array}{'.($self->{array_template} || ('c'x$d)).'}'."\n".$TeX.'\end{array}';
00045   return $TeX unless $open || $close;
00046   $open  = "." if $close && !$open;
00047   $close = "." if $open && !$close;
00048   return '\left'.$open.$TeX.'\right'.$close;
00049 }
00050 
00051 #
00052 #  Recursively handle the rows, but only enclose in brackets
00053 #  to form reference to array of (references to arrays of ...) entries
00054 #
00055 sub perl {
00056   my $self = shift; my $parens = shift; my $matrix = shift;
00057   my $perl; my @p = ();
00058   foreach my $x (@{$self->{coords}}) {push(@p,$x->perl(0,1))}
00059   if ($matrix) {
00060     $perl = '['.join(',',@p).']';
00061   } else {
00062     $perl = $self->Package($self->type).'->new('.join(',',@p).')';
00063     $perl = '('.$perl.')' if $parens;
00064   }
00065   return $perl;
00066 }
